title: Nice place
review: This is good place inside the Agra fort and made it well. you can see this as one of nice place to visit.

title: Beautiful Dome
review: This is the place where Shah Jahan was imprisoned and from where he viewed the Taj in his final days.

title: Last Kingdom of Shahjahan
review: This is the place in the red fort where shahjahan can see the taj at the time when he had captured by Aurangzeb. During his old age his far sight became weak and he could not see the Taj Mahal, and he fell ill in sorrow. So his daughters installed a special mirror in the room which gives the Taj Mahal reflections on a mirror inside the room, this ways he could watch Taj during his last days. Shah Jahan for sure lived a royal life during his rule, but in his last time he lived miserably

title: Not a lot to see
review: Didn't actually visit this attraction as it could be seen quite clearly from our accommodation.  At the time that we were there I think there was some work going on as there was a ladder going from one floor to the other on the outside which the local children seemed to be using as a play area.

title: Shah Burj,
review: Do not miss this tower. Burj means tower , with some spendid views of the historical monument.  Should not be missed

title: Small Tower Structure Inside Agra Fort
review: This Burj meaning tower is inside the Agra Fort. As you are already inside the fort it is worth seeing but not otherwise. You get a very good view from the tower over the whole area of the fort. Shah Jahan was imprisoned here in his last days.

title: Palatial prison
review: If one had to be imprisoned by one of your four sons (who had already killed his three brothers) for eight years, then this would certainly not be a bad place for it.

title: Nice...
review: You can get a beautiful view from this burj.

title: Fantastic Taj Views
review: Go to Agra Fort during sunset to experience the red sandstone take on an amazing hue. Also get unfettered Taj views.

title: About shah burj
review: it is very beautiful within the vicinity of red fort, agra. It is meant for the common people who want to pay attention to thier grivances directly to Emperor Jahangir at that time by bell installed outside the fort.

title: A prison for shah Jahan
review: The tower here was where shah Jahan lived out his final years,,,, imprisoned by his son. The irony is that he could look out the window and see the beautiful Taj Mahal across the river.

title: Shah Jahan's spent his last days here watching Taj
review: It is told that this is the same place where Shah Jahan was imprisoned by his son Aurangjeb. Shah Jahan loved his wife Mumtaj very much and he built Taj Mahal in her memory. In the later part of his rule, he was imprisoned by his son, it is said that Shah Jahan decided to build another makbara of black stone which could have costed lot more than the Taj Mahal. Fearing it might happen, his son Aurangjeb (after he revolted and became king) imprisoned him inside the Agra fort in this room. As Shanjahan loved Mumtaj a lot so he used to view Taj while remembering her from this room every day. During his old age his far sight became weak and he could not see the Taj Mahal, and he fell ill in sorrow. So his daughters installed a special mirror in the room which gives the Taj Mahal reflections on a mirror inside the room, this ways he could watch Taj during his last days. Shah Jahan for sure lived a royal life during his rule, but in his last time he lived miserably.

title: a small but fantasic part of the fort
review: the contrast between the white marble and the red sandstone of Agra fort is highlighted here so well.  Even in the heat of the day this was a cool spot to sit and look out at the Taj in the distance

title: Unique
review: Shah burj is very unique. I have seen many old fortresses like this in Agra but this is something different. This is amazing. It is said that here Shahjah passed on the last day of his life. Must visit place.

title: Part of the fort
review: Part of Agra Fort. This s the most interesting bit and the bit facing the Taj that attracts the most visitor. Must see.

title: Good
review: Shah Burj is one of the monuments that Shah Jahan has built for his wife Mumtaz Mahal. It is an octagonal tower located near the Duwan e Khas in Agra Fort. It is also known as Musamman Burj. This magnificent tower symbolizes the era of Mughals and their taste for splendid architecture.

title: nice looking octagonal structure
review: Shah-burj, is an octagonal tower standing close to Diwan-e-Khas in Agra Fort.It is made of delicate marbles with ornamental niches.The decoration of the walls is pietra dura. The chamber has a marble dome on top and is surrounded by a verandah with a beautiful carved fountain in the center.One can see the most poignant views of the Taj Mahal from here. It is the place where Shah Jahan along with his favorite daughter Jahanara Begum had spent his last few years as a captive.

title: View on the Taj Mahal
review: This location is especially interesting as it has an impressive view on the Taj Mahal with the river next to it !

title: Spectacular view of the grand Taj Mahal
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited the iconic Agra Fort which is a UNESCO World Heritage site and this is located inside fort complex. This is the place where Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan was kept in exile by his son Aurangzeb during the last years of his life and he is believed to have died here. Here we saw a beautiful tower with a golden dome and a marble balcony offering spectacular view of the grand Taj Mahal. It is said that Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan had spent the last days of his life watching the Taj from here. Shah Burj is a must visit attraction inside the fort because of the view of magnificent Taj Mahal across the Yamuna river.

title: The Must for all visitors of Agra Fort.
review: Shah Burj or Mussummen Burj or Jasmine Tower , all take you to the heart of the agra Fort , a very elegent white marble structure with lot of beutiful inlay work of semi precious stones is basically a room, a balcony, a water fountain and a small courtyard.

title: Ultimate view of The Taj
review: This is the place where Shahjahan was kept in Jail. Situated at the bank of River Yamuna it gives a stunning view of Taj Mahal from it.

title: Shah Burj Buliding!!!
review: The Shah burj building is very nice and beautiful with white marble.The Photographic view was excellent.

title: The White Palace Tower
review: This octagonal white tower with the gilded copper dome was quite literally the gilded cage used to imprison Shah Jahan by his own son. I learned and experienced the cruelty of this location—it has a clear view of the Taj Mahal, the final resting place of Shah Jahan’s beloved wife. Ironically, Shah Jahan never visited the completed Taj Mahal in life. His final “visit” occurred in death when he was buried at the Taj Mahal along with his beloved Mumtaz Mahal. The only comfort that Shah Jahan was afforded in his last days was that his daughters, Roshnara and Jahanara lived in the Khas Mahal, the white palace which is adjoined to the Shah Burj. I also found the gardens in front of the Khas Mahal to be quite beautiful, though they must have been a reminder of Shah Jahan’s loss of freedom when he viewed them from the tower.

title: Shah Burg
review: Its called the Shajahan's residential area and its where he was inprisoned by his sun Aurangazeb. Its a beutiful place with a view to the taj Mahal

title: Nice place to be
review: We were here during our Agra tour. It was a quick and nice stopover. Good view of the city from the top.

title: Great views
review: It is in this place we have the bests views of Taj Mahal from Agra Fort, one of the few places now in Agra Fort where we can go to na upper level, everywhere else is closed, maybe for restoration or who knows why.

title: Simple yet enticing!
review: Shah Burj, also known as Musamman Burj is a delicate citadel located near DIwan-e-Khas in Agra Fort. One must visit the Shah Burj and experience the magical view of the Taj from there. Also, pay close attention to the jharokhas and marble pillars that display some of the most beautiful inlay work of the Mughal era.

title: Beautiful
review: It is situated inside the Agra Fort. It is said that from the windows/jharokhas of this burj, Shah Jahan used to look at Taj Mahal and remembered his late wife. Visit this place with a guide to hear more stories regarding this place. Unfortunately, this place is closed for public now as public has damaged some of the embedded stones and carvings of this place (as told to us by the guide).

title: Taj's viewport for Shahjahan
review: This is inside the Agra fort and a part of the Diwan E Khaas. This was apparently the place from where Shahjahan had his view of the the Taj.

title: for views - it is spectacular
review: i cannot begin to explain how beautiful the view from most of the spots here are. the yamuna river and the taj can be spotted from here. though you have to be ready to walk around here because it is a long walk around to see places or if you have your car then you can drive around slowly

title: Beautiful building with great views of the Taj
review: We visited here on Monday 12th February as part of our guided tour of Agra Fort. It is a 3 storey building and octagonal in shape with a domed roof. It is made from white marble with the most amazing intricate inlays.

title: Part of Agra fort
review: This burj also known as Musamman Burj. It's octagonal tower from standing over here you have view of taj mahal. Nice place to visit in agra fort.

title: A place in Agra fort to have a clear view of Taj Mahal
review: This place is also inside the Agra fort itself .Just akin to this is the royal chair of the erstwhile emperor, where he used to sit with his kin men, Diwan-e-khas!

title: Shah burj
review: Shah burj is the also a one major tourist destination of agra..place is mughal era creation and got spectacular view of surround from here

title: Known as the Emperor's Tower
review: Known as the Emperor's tower is another of the spaces not to be missed inside the Agra Red Fort.

title: Shah Burj @ Agra Fort - The Best Spot to view Taj Mahal at distance
review: Also known as the Musamman Burj, the Shah Burj is an elaborate octagonal tower located near the Diwan-e-Khas. It was commissioned by Shah Jahan for his cherished wife, Mumtaz Mahal. Before was built, in its place stood a small marble palace built by Akbar. This tower offers a stunning view of the Taj Mahal, and must have been (several hundred years ago...) something so beautiful... (now its a big sewer). Recommended to stop for some shots, but don't spend more that 15 minutes, included in your ticket.

title: Last days
review: It is an integral part of Agra fort in North East side where Shah Jahan spent his last days of life.

title: Best view of TAJ from here
review: This is the same part for Agra fort, where Emperor Shahajahan was confined by his son Aurangzeb for long 8 year. But he was under the care of his daughter Jahanara took care of him until he died . from here he used to watch to Tajmahal which was built by him for his beloved wife Mumtaj mahal. when he was suppose to die that time he asked to his daughter to raise his head on her thigh so that he could see to Tajmahal at the last moment and just after that he took the last breathe of his life . overall this is beautiful part of fort where from you can enjoy the mesmerizing view of Taj .

title: Part of Agra Fort
review: It is also a part of agra fort. you can have a nice view of taj. Nothing special to do here. You can have some nice click.

title: beautiful building of Agra fort.
review: This is one of the finest building in agra fort with white marble.The entire building was decorated with inlay work.The name of the building is musuman burz .This was  the building where shahjahan was kept in house arrest.

title: Last days of Shah Jahan
review: This is nice building where Shah Jahan spent his last days as his own son kept him in Jail. This provides direct view of Taj.

title: Just Another part of Agra fort
review: It is another major part of Agra fort with very nice views of River YamunaJi & Taj-Mahal. Nice blows of wind could be experienced here.

title: A highlight of the Agra Fort
review: One can easily spend an hour examining the elements of this interesting part of the Agra fort.Magical craftsmanship combined by a mesmerizing vision.

title: Inside Agra fort
review: This attraction is part of Agra Fort only.. One can see beautiful Taj Mahal from this area on the fort..

title: Nice views of the Taj
review: This was the best part of Agra Fort.  Nice views of the Taj Mahal and the white marble structure is very pretty.  This is where the 5th Mughal emperor, the builder of the Taj, was imprisoned here by his own son for bankrupting the nation by building the mausoleum for his wife.

title: Beautiful Octagonal Tower
review: Beautiful Octagonal tower near the Yamuna River. This part is one of best in Agra Fort. One can get a good view of Taj from here. So one can spend lot of time admiring beauty of nature ( Yamuna river) along with marvelous architecture ( both Agra Fort and Taj Mahal)

title: Fantastic inlaid decoration
review: While visiting the Agra Fort you cannot miss the Musamman Burj also known as the Saman Burj or the Shah-burj, which is an octagonal tower standing close to the Shah Jahan's private hall Diwan-e-Khas in Agra Fort

title: Nice Place
review: It is a very good place to see. it is on the hill so ready to walk around 4 to 5 km or use your own vehicle. from the Top sunset look nice .

title: Beautiful view
review: This is an octagonal tower located inside the Agra fort .. You can see the Taj Mahal and the Yamuna river from her which made it one of the best places in the fort .. The view is beautiful.. The structure in itself has intricate work

title: great architecture
review: don't need any extra time because it is inside the fortand part of agra fort.

title: Shah Burj
review: This is an octagonal tower located within the Agra Fort. It has a great view of Taj Mahal and Yamuna. One can still find a few mirrors on the ceiling and walls. Architecturally a very nice location in the fort.

title: Double view point for Taj & Yamuna River!
review: Shah Burj is the Double view point for Taj & Yamuna River! octagonal tower situated near Yamuna where you can feel the nature and dream the sketch of Mughal Empire!  Great architectural view along with Mirrors in ceiling.

title: mesmerising view
review: Due to reconstruction work it is closed but from there you can view the very beautiful view of the abode of love Taj Mahal . It  gives a full reminiscent of splendid Mughal   that what had happened to the glorious past of Medieval India . From there we can view the colorful bank of river yamuna  . Where washer men dry their clothes on the bank . And we can view the British railway bridge that was laid in mid nineteenth century .

title: A must visit for Fort lovers
review: A must visit for Fort lovers, Take enough time to enjoy the marvel. It will take around 3 hours to see this completely.

title: Historic
review: This Is Inside Agra Fort from where Shahjahan used to ses Taj Mahal during his last days of captivity. For those interested in history.

title: Beautiful
review: This is a part of Agra fort where shahjehan spent his last days under house arrest initiated by his son Aurangazeb.

title: Full of marble glory
review: This is the prison where Shah Jahan spent his days after being captured by his son Aurangzeb. Very beautiful, completely marble everywhere. Taj can be seen in the background and looks lovely. There is a marble tub engraved in the floor where Shah Jahan used to take bath.

title: Shah Jahan's last few days
review: This is where Shah Jahan spent his last few days. You can view the Taj Mahal from here. This is inside the Agra Fort.

title: Amazing Extension
review: This place was built by the Mughals for the entertainment purpose only. It is an octagonal tower with special beauty attached to it. This place had lot of mirrors in the ancient time and some mirrors can be still found attached to the roof and wall. Entry was permitted till the barriers only.  The crafted glasses embedded on the walls clearly show the development of the engineering in those days. Our guide was very well versed with the place and he explained us about the history of the place.

title: Amazing view of Taj Mahal
review: It is located within the Agra Fort and as the name suggests, constitute the ramparts of the fort. A beautiful view of Taj Mahal is visible from the ramparts. This is the location in Agra Fort, where Shahjahan was imprisoned by Aurangzeb and where he spent his last days viewing the Taj Mahal.

title: Shining Burz
review: The Shah Burz is shining burz part of the Agra Fort and itself is a monument to admire. During sunlight the burz gives another look.

title: Part of a visit for awardees from our company
review: This is another terrific monument and if you go to the Taj mahal you must go and see this attraction and listen to the history.

title: Must visit while visiting Agra
review: One should make sure not to miss Shah Burj while visiting Agra, and to understand the significance of the place and also to be able to appreciate the place properly hire a qualified and licensed guide. Do make sure you take a licensed guide and not just someone as that will make a major difference to the overall experience.

title: beautiful architecture
review: This place is inside the agra fort. Very beautifully made, carved and masterpiece of architecture. One should not miss it inside fort. Guide is needed to know the importance of this part of agra fort.

title: Stunning hand work and Ambiance view
review: really a magical place inside the red fort area.. all area is like a memorizing fairy tail..all walls are decorated with semi prestigious stones of multicolored, stone carving and inlay work on pillars and walls, and floor are beautiful,, and seen The Taj and river from there is a different experience..

title: Excellent Place
review: The burj is inside of the red fort of agra and an excellent place to see the surroundings. To understand the importance and purpose one must take guide while seeing the monument,

title: Shah Jahan's "prison"
review: Shah burj located in Agra Fort. This is the palace's balcony where Moghul emperor Shah Jahan spent his last days watching over Taj Mahal. It is a wonderful feeling to be here and to imagine Shah Jahan actually sat in the very balcony viewing the Taj.

title: So beautuful!
review: Very beautiful building. The pillars and the ceiling beautifully decorated. Can see the Taj Mahal from the Veranda.

title: A marble Palace of flawless beauty
review: The Shah Burj also known as the Mussaman Burj ( also as the Jasmine Tower), is an integral part of the Royal Apartments. It is a marble Palace of flawless beauty with fantastic inlay work and marble fountains. Shahjahan was held captive here for almost eight years - his melancholia is still evident . Must visit !

title: A Beautiful Building within Agra Fort
review: The Shah Burg is within the Agra Fort complex and is beautiful architecture. The Agra Fort is very large so make sure you look for this.

title: Feel the history
review: This is a structure one should feel. It is better if one visits this place on a day when crowd is not there.

title: "Delicate marble"
review: Shah Burj was built by Shah Jahan for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. It is made of  marble. It is well maintained.

title: Very lice view
review: Shah burj is very famous area under Agra fort dewan e khas. You can view very log view through this nurj balcony.

title: Situated inside agra fort
review: Shah burj is situated inside the agra fort. This is the place where mughal emperor Shahjahan used to see tajmahal. This is a stunning palace.

title: Wonderful view of the Taj Mahal from here
review: Excellent view of the Yamuna river and the Taj Mahal from here. Shah Jahan used to look at the Taj Mahal from here when he was imprisoned here by his son Aurangzeb.

title: Excellent View
review: This monument is on a side of the river Yamuna and the wter view adds so much glory to this. Can also see the Taj Mahal from this which gives a mini view of the glory of Taj Mahal.

title: Very beautiful building
review: Shah burj is very beautiful building along with yamuna river, you can view taj taj mahal and yamuna rivier at top of shah burj. It covers a very large area from its TOP jharokha.

title: Nice place inside Agra Fort
review: This is a place for the special members of the parliaments (in older days) in order to take any important decision or at times to enjoy game shows etc. together. There is a separate chair for the king and the members. One portion of the chair is destroyed by the british canon fire. This place can be covered as a part of Agra fort tour.

title: very beautiful apartment
review: This was the apartment where Shahjahan used to spend his evenings seeing the Tajmahal. This is one of my favorite place too see the Tajmahal too from Agra fort.

title: Airy place !
review: This cross ventilated palace historical known as Hammam-i-shahi, is a part of the agra Fort and it is situated on the right corner of the fort and views of the beautiful taj were magnificent from the windows of this place.It is presumed that this place used by the royals to seat in the cold wind during mornings and evenings of the hot summer days,as the place is engineered cross ventilated and balance of air energy is well taken care of here which shows the marvel of construction of those times.

title: A Part of Agra Fort
review: Diwaan e Khas and Diwaan e Aam, both are part of Agra Fort. This place is special as the king used to gather with his ministers here to take important decisions. One can cover this place as a part of Agra fort tour. Taj Mahal is visible from this place.

title: Very beautiful
review: Located near the Agra fort, the Burj was so beautiful! and is crowded all the time and it a royal place to sit in the cloud wind in the morning

title: Shah Jahan's tower
review: Also known as Musamman Burj, this is part of Shah Jahan's palace complex in Agra Fort. There is a fantastic view across to the Taj Mahal on a clear day. If you are travelling in December and here early in the morning be prepared for fog. Just next to the tower is a black Onyx slab. This is Emperor Jehangir's throne.

title: really good....
review: Also known as the Musamman Burj, the Shah Burj is an elaborate octagonal tower located near the Diwan-e-Khas (hall of private audience) in Agra Fort.

title: Whispers of History
review: Shah Burj is one of the monuments that Shah Jahan has built for his wife Mumtaz Mahal. It is an octagonal tower located near the Duwan e Khas in Agra Fort. It is also known as Musamman Burj. This magnificent tower symbolizes the era of Mughals and their taste for splendid architecture.

title: History comes to you to speak
review: A wonderful monument, good view of Taj from here tell stories about the rich past. A must to visit place.

title: great historical monument
review: Saman Burj or the Shah-burj, is an octagonal tower standing close to the Shah Jahan's private hall Diwan-e-Khas in Agra. It just rocks even now.

title: Agra Fort
review: Shah Burj was built by Shah Jahan for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. It is said that at first a small marble palace built by Akbar was situated at this site, which was later demolished by Jehangir to erect new buildings. Shah Jahan in his turn chose this site to erect the multi-storied marble tower inlaid with precious stones for Mumtaz Mahal. It was built between 1631–40 and offers exotic views of the famous Taj Mahal.

title: History Buffs
review: This marvelous marble structure is one of the monuments built by Shah Jahan for his wife, Mumtaz Mahal

title: Delicate marble lattices with ornamental niches!!!!
review: Shah-burj, also called Musamman Burj  is a beautiful octagonal tower placed close to Shah Jahan's private hall Diwan-e-Khas inside Agra Fort. The chamber has a marble dome on top & is made of delicate marble lattices with ornamental niches - one can only enjoy the architectural splendour of this tower , however it also offers exotic views of the famous Taj Mahal and the Yamuna River. The tower is a reminder of the rich architecture of the bygone mughal era. Cameras are allowed, visit early to avoid crowd.

title: Beautiful Dome
review: This is the place where Shah Jahan was imprisoned and from where he viewed the Taj in his final days.

title: A Beautiful Monument
review: Shah Burj, also well-known as Hammam-i-Shahi. It is located in Agra Fort at the right of Diwan-e-Khas. This is a stunning palace which is perfectly airy apartment and it is assumed that the King and Royal family members were using this as a summer retreat.

title: Octagonal Tower
review: Located on the right of  Diwan-e-Khas, a beautiful octagonal tower standing close to the Shah Jahan's private hall in Agra Fort. Its original purpose was to serve as a Shah Burj, where the sultan would discuss state affairs with his closest courtiers.

title: Truly beautiful
review: Located near the Agra fort, the Burj was so beautiful! Be prepared as there is lots of walking, loads of monkeys and can be crowded at times

title: Nice place
review: This is good place inside the Agra fort and made it well. you can see this as one of nice place to visit.

title: Last Kingdom of Shahjahan
review: This is the place in the red fort where shahjahan can see the taj at the time when he had captured by Aurangzeb. During his old age his far sight became weak and he could not see the Taj Mahal, and he fell ill in sorrow. So his daughters installed a special mirror in the room which gives the Taj Mahal reflections on a mirror inside the room, this ways he could watch Taj during his last days. Shah Jahan for sure lived a royal life during his rule, but in his last time he lived miserably

title: Palatial prison
review: If one had to be imprisoned by one of your four sons (who had already killed his three brothers) for eight years, then this would certainly not be a bad place for it.

title: Small Tower Structure Inside Agra Fort
review: This Burj meaning tower is inside the Agra Fort. As you are already inside the fort it is worth seeing but not otherwise. You get a very good view from the tower over the whole area of the fort. Shah Jahan was imprisoned here in his last days.

title: Fantastic Taj Views
review: Go to Agra Fort during sunset to experience the red sandstone take on an amazing hue. Also get unfettered Taj views.

title: Not a lot to see
review: Didn't actually visit this attraction as it could be seen quite clearly from our accommodation.  At the time that we were there I think there was some work going on as there was a ladder going from one floor to the other on the outside which the local children seemed to be using as a play area.

title: Nice...
review: You can get a beautiful view from this burj.

review: Do not miss this tower. Burj means tower , with some spendid views of the historical monument.  Should not be missed

So his daughters installed a special mirror in the room which gives the Taj Mahal reflections on a mirror inside the room, this ways he could watch Taj during his last days. Shah Jahan for sure lived a royal life during his rule, but in his last time he lived miserably

title: Nice place
review: This is good place inside the Agra fort and made it well. you can see this as one of nice place to visit.

title: Not a lot to see
review: Didn't actually visit this attraction as it could be seen quite clearly from our accommodation.  At the time that we were there I think there was some work going on as there was a ladder going from one floor to the other on the outside which the local children seemed to be using as a play area.

title: Shah Burj,
review: Do not miss this tower. Burj means tower , with some spendid views of the historical monument.  Should not be missed

title: Nice...
review: You can get a beautiful view from this burj.

title: Fantastic Taj Views
review: Go to Agra Fort during sunset to experience the red sandstone take on an amazing hue. Also get unfettered Taj views.

title: Last Kingdom of Shahjahan
review: This is the place in the red fort where shahjahan can see the taj at the time when he had captured by Aurangzeb. During his old age his far sight became weak and he could not see the Taj Mahal, and he fell ill in sorrow. So his daughters installed a special mirror in the room which gives the Taj Mahal reflections on a mirror inside the room, this ways he could watch Taj during his last days. Shah Jahan for sure lived a royal life during his rule, but in his last time he lived miserably

title: About shah burj
review: it is very beautiful within the vicinity of red fort, agra. It is meant for the common people who want to pay attention to thier grivances directly to Emperor Jahangir at that time by bell installed outside the fort.

title: Small Tower Structure Inside Agra Fort
review: This Burj meaning tower is inside the Agra Fort. As you are already inside the fort it is worth seeing but not otherwise. You get a very good view from the tower over the whole area of the fort. Shah Jahan was imprisoned here in his last days.

title: Palatial prison
review: If one had to be imprisoned by one of your four sons (who had already killed his three brothers) for eight years, then this would certainly not be a bad place for it.
